message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.SY

Reasoning: 
1. cs.LG (Machine Learning): The paper proposes a learning approach using deep reinforcement learning agents to transfer knowledge from one environment to another. 
2. cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence): The paper explores the use of asynchronous advantage actor critic (A3C) architecture to generalize a target game using an agent trained on a source game in Atari. 
3. cs.CV (Computer Vision): The paper uses visual mapping between video sequences of transfer pairs to derive new representations of the target game, which improves model updates in terms of performance, data efficiency and stability. 
4. cs.RO (Robotics): The paper proposes a method to transfer knowledge between different environments, which can be useful in robotics applications where robots need to adapt to new environments. 
5. cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper proposes a learning approach to update the model using multiple agents trained in parallel with different representations of the target game, which can be seen as a control problem.
